subject: Design
title: Deadstock Design: Fashion from Factory Waste
description: A short lesson to help you apply Deadstock Design: Fashion from Factory Waste.

hook.text: Fashion brands destroy billions of dollars of unsold clothes every year. Some designers rescue them instead.

buildup.text: Deadstock fabric is unused material left over from production runs. It's high-quality and destined for landfill.

discovery.text: Brands like Reformation and Zero Waste Daniel build entire collections from rescued factory waste.

twist.text: Burberry burned $37 million in unsold goods in 2018 rather than discount them. They changed policy after the outcry.

climax.text: Deadstock design proves that the material for sustainable fashion already exists ‚Äî it's just being thrown away.

punchline.text: The most sustainable fabric is the one that already exists.

quiz.question: What is deadstock fabric?
options: Unused factory material destined for landfill
